item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "The country was in peril; he was jeopardizing his traditional rights of freedom and independence by daring to exercise them." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "In the councils of government, we must guard against the acquisition of unwarranted influence, whether sought or unsought, by the military industrial complex. The potential for the disastrous rise of misplaced power exists and will persist. We must never let the weight of this combination endanger our liberties or democratic processes. We should take nothing for granted. Only an alert and knowledgeable citizenry can compel the proper meshing of the huge industrial and military machinery of defense with our peaceful methods and goals, so that security and liberty may prosper together." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Nathan add a quote by David Milch
item.description: "Pain or damage don't end the world. Or despair, or fucking beatings. The world ends when you're dead. Until then, you've got more punishment in store. Stand it like a man... and give some back." -- David Milch

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "It was the first time I was ever in love, and I learned a lot. Before that I'd never even thought about killing myself." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "How often we recall with regret that Napoleon once shot at a magazine editor and missed him and killed a publisher. But we remember with charity that his intentions were good." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nathan add a quote by H. R. Haldeman
item.description: "We move to Camp David and we hide. They can't get in there." -- H. R. Haldeman

item.title: Nathan add a quote by David Bowie
item.description: "If you want it, boys, get it here, thing." -- David Bowie

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Kingsley Amis
item.description: "Laziness has become the chief characteristic of journalism, displacing incompetence. " -- Kingsley Amis

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Aeschylus
item.description: "Wisdom comes through suffering. Trouble, with its memories of pain, Drips in our hearts as we try to sleep, So men against their will Learn to practice moderation. Favours come to us from gods." -- Aeschylus

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Bill Maher
item.description: "That's what's so great about the Internet. It allows pompous blow-hards to connect with other pompous blow-hards in a vast circle-jerk of pomposity." -- Bill Maher

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "You know you really need some help. A regular psychiatrist couldn't even help you. You need to go to like Vienna or something. You know what I mean? You need to get involved at the University level. Like where Freud studied and have all those people looking at you and checking up on you. That's the kind of help you need. Not the once a week for eighty bucks. No. You need a team. A team of psychiatrists working round the clock thinking about you, having conferences, observing you, like the way they did with the Elephant Man. That's what I'm talking about because that's the only way you're going to get better." -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "With a little ingenuity and vision, he had made it all but impossible for anyone in the squadron to talk to him, which was just fine with everyone, he noticed, since no one wanted to talk to him anyway." -- Joseph Heller
